summary: App for ADHD women in perimenopause providing support, ideas, and coping mechanisms.
imageRequirements:

- Warm, calming abstract floral illustration with earthy tones (home-hero.dim_1600x900.png)

existing_features.title: Create the core app information architecture and navigation for an app focused on ADHD women in perimenopause, with sections for: Home, Coping Toolkit, Topics/Library, Daily Check-in, Journal, and Saved/Favorites.

Implement a coherent visual theme and design system for the app (colors, typography, spacing, components) with a calm, supportive style suitable for perimenopause + ADHD. Avoid blue/purple as primary colors.

Build a Coping Toolkit feature that lets users browse coping mechanisms as cards and filter by category (e.g., Focus/Executive Function, Emotional Regulation, Sleep, Hot Flashes/Night Sweats, Brain Fog, Anxiety, Relationships, Work, Self-care).

Create a Topics/Library section with short, structured educational content tailored to ADHD + perimenopause (e.g., hormones & attention, overwhelm loops, sensory sensitivity, sleep changes). Include a friendly disclaimer that the content is not medical advice.

Implement a Daily Check-in flow where users can quickly log today’s state using simple sliders/buttons (e.g., focus, mood, energy, sleep quality, hot flash severity, anxiety/irritability) and optional notes.

Add a Journal feature for free-form entries with optional prompts relevant to the audience (e.g., ‘What felt hardest today?’, ‘What helped even a little?’, ‘What’s one kind thing I can do for myself?’).
Add Saved/Favorites so users can bookmark coping mechanisms and library topics and access them in one place.

Implement Internet Identity sign-in and ensure all user-specific data (check-ins, journal entries, saved items) is scoped to the authenticated user principal; allow read-only browsing of general content without sign-in.
Add generated static illustrations and use them in the UI (e.g., on Home and empty states) from frontend/public/assets/generated, without routing images through the backend.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create an app focused on ADHD women in perimenopause with help and ideas for coping mechanisms.
Backend: define and expose Motoko actor methods to (1) list coping mechanisms and topics, and (2) CRUD user-specific records (check-ins, journal entries, saved items) with stable persistence.
